column2: Joining the WOP team, you will be at the forefront of our operational relationships with internal stakeholders and external customers, ensuring the seamless delivery of core datasets that power our current and future WOP initiatives.          As a Senior Manager, you will be instrumental in meeting all KPIs for data collection, verification, validation, and delivering APIs to our valued customers.          Your domain expertise will be essential in developing new products and gathering valuable feedback from both internal and external clients, providing valuable user stories for future solution development.                              What you ll do:                      Lead and mentor a talented team of 10+ members, fostering their growth and development.              Cultivate strategic partnerships with key business stakeholders, shaping product data collection, structure, and content.          Uphold data governance to ensure the utmost quality and conformity across our products and services for external customers.          Engage in frequent, meaningful dialogues with customers to ensure we continuously exceed their expectations and stay attuned to their requirements.          Collaborate with the Inchcape Network to maintain the accuracy and excellence of data pertaining to PTB, Line up data, and more.          Work closely with Management and the Data team to enhance product specifications and deliver exceptional data samples to external clients, perfectly aligned with their needs.              Champion the development of a centralized framework for data services, empowering the consumption of our data sets across the organization.          Provide consistent and compelling data stories that support our roadmap and pipeline of projects, ensuring smooth delivery to the team.          Skilfully manage various data work streams executed within the team, employing your expertise to provide "thought leadership" throughout the organization.          Curate and manage artifacts that underpin new and existing processes, definitions, and outcomes, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness.          Take charge of sprint delivery ceremonies and provide insightful progress updates to senior managers.                      Who you are:                      You possess extensive experience in the Maritime Domain, coupled with hands-on knowledge of Port terminals Berth, vessel operations, and Port Operations.          Your understanding of Marine Assurance and strong networks within the maritime sector set you apart as a true expert.              You recognize the critical role of information in supporting maritime commercial and operational decision-making and risk mitigation.          Knowledge of the digital transformation in the Shipping industry positions you as a forward-thinking leader.          You have a proven ability to inspire, mentor, and motivate teams, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.          Your comprehensive knowledge of major software packages and project management skills are second to none.          With your track record in successfully managing data projects and delivering large-scale IT systems, youre well-equipped to tackle any challenge.              Adaptable and skilled in managing projects through change, you excel in reporting progress and ensuring outcomes align with objectives.          Experience in an SME environment has honed your ability to navigate conflicting priorities with ease.          Your experience in working with geographically dispersed teams and managing departmental standards positions you as a well-rounded leader, capable of achieving exceptional results.
column11: Career development, Assurance, Maritime, Diversity and Inclusion, Data collection, Healthcare, Customer service, Operations, Team building, Customer interaction

column1: Sr. Executive / Officer Safety For central suburbs.
column2: Hi, We are looking for Sr. Executive / Safety Officer - in central suburbs: Brief JD: Advising the project management in appropriate amendments in the procedures to maintain good level safety Management System. Preparing safety plan for the project. Assisting the project management with the preparation of project specific safety objective & procedures. Developing and implementing Safety training programs for employees. Submit weekly inspection reports and advice on action for improvement. To ensure Fire Extinguisher & First Aid box monthly inspections done. Developing & Administering interest sustaining promotional safety activities to enhance development & environmental awareness among employees. Investigate & maintain records of All Accidents & incidents including near misses. To conduct mock drills.  Able to provide Safety Induction & give instructions at Site B.Sc/BE with ADIS must Must have 5-10yrs of safety exposure working with Contracting firm and handling residential projects

Should be well versed in all forms of communication and documentation such as presentations, reporting, oral and written communication. He should be able to handle all project-related documentation. column2: Human Resource  Job   Description-SHEQ Doc. No.  MIPL/HR/F/023  Issue   No .- 01   Issue   Date - 02.07.2018  Revision   No . -01 Revision   Date - 15.12.2022 Assistant   Manager/Senior   Executive     SHEQ   and   TMW Purpose/Overview The SHEQ and TMW coordinator is responsible for managing and improving depot function and team performance for SHEQ and TMW functions. This includes policies, programs and projects within the depot that may be initiated by the management of Manlift. Role required to reviews and updates institutional regulations based on local and governmental policies. Furthermore, conducting risk assessments to detect potential hazards, with preparation and implementation of appropriate countermeasures for these hazards applies to the role. Organizational   Structure Reports   to - SHEQ and TMW Manager and dotted line reporting to Depot Manager. Tasks   and   Responsibilities ??Create awareness about SHEQ and TMW at all levels in the depot to mitigate risks and drive the knowledge sharing, TMW  culture and application of relevant Health & safety standards and SHEQ Best Practices in the depot. Control compliance to  applicable legislation and Regulations; including related to labor and Environment. ??Ensuring all EHS legal requirement must be complied, fulfilled and documented. ??Implement our SHEQ management system, manage performance against ISO 45001 and implement other relevant standards  such as ISO 14001 and ISO 9001 following local requirements????? Ensuring all the formats/documents must be documented. ??Coordinate and responsible for SHEQ Maturity, CIR and ISO Audits at depot as and when required as per schedule. Manage and  follow Continuous Improvement Reviews (CIR??), report on adoption level of The Manlift Way, develop and monitor execution  of Action Plan to exploit identified opportunity. ??Report and analyses incidents, near misses and accidents and drive the prevention plans. Ensure closure of all near misses and incident reported within time frame. ??Yard and site tools calibration register monitoring and carrying out the schedule monitoring check. Yard equipment fitness test and third party inspection. ??Carrying out First aid, fire safety and defensive driving training for employees. Carrying out routine heath checkup plan to the staff as per the company policy. ??Ensuring regular safety checks for all lifting, shifting tools, tackles, wire ropes, chain pulley and machinery. Monitoring and recording of Air, water, Illumination, Noise, soil reports on periodic basis. ??Following Established Emergency Preparedness and Response plan. Performing effective chemical management in the depot. (Chemical risk management, MSDS display and its awareness). ??Planning and conducting monthly, half yearly and yearly safety meetings with safety committee members and follow a structured improvement process. ??Following and conducting annual SHEQ Training plan and completing trainings (Monthly/TBT) as per the plan and Collecting the training completion, feedback and evaluation records. ??Act as contact person for SHEQ issues to external and internal stakeholders. Following internal and external effective communication plan and matrix as per requirement. ??Periodic reporting to SHEQ, TMW and Depot Manager provided in a timely manner. ??Initiates, facilitates and leads assigned Kaizen Events using methods of team building, team energizing, data gathering and  analysis, problem solving, project management. ??Monthly /weekly meeting with TMW champion and depot manager to share status of KPI/Kaizen and implementation of Best Practices within the depot. ??Work with team members to identify and implement best practices that will improve performance within the depot. ??Attend training provided by TMW Champions to elevate their knowledge from the TMW perspective and to promote the  sharing of good ideas and best practices across the depot.   Manlift   Core   Values   Function   Key   Competencies - Safety - Integrity - Analytical Thinking - Stress Management - Diversity - Teamwork - Solutions Orientation - Communication  - Sustainability - Thoroughness - Flexibility - Assertiveness Requirements: -Graduate/Post   graduate   in   Engineering. -   PDIS   in   Post   Diploma   Industrial   safety. -   Minimum   3-5   years   of   experience. -   Preferred   Experience   in   the   process,   automobile   or   any   engineering   manufacturing   /   service   industry.  - Enthusiastic and Self-motivated. - Team player with excellent communication and people management skills. - Computer literate with proficiency in MS office. - Fluent in English, Hindi , Local Language will be an advantage.

column2: Role Objective:  Primary deliverable of this role is to ensure effective implementation of company EHS policies and procedures at sites.   Key Responsibilities Ensuring the EHS compliance for their respective projects in construction operation & maintenance work. Daily Safety Inspections to ensure safe work practices Ensures the safe disposal/storage of hazardous wastage Maintenance of personal proactive & firefighting equipment Maintaining & updating material safety data sheets for raw materials & finished products. Training the employees & contractors on: EHS Regulations Handling of Hazardous Chemicals Use of Personal Protective Equipments Fire Fighting To establish sound Contingency plans for Emergency Issue safety alerts to project management office about any unsafe act/condition at site Prepare and submit confirmatory reports on a regular basis Prepare site specific training modules and conduct presentations and training on site for staff & labors Regular Audits of Construction Area/ labor Camps/ Stores  Regular Health Monitoring of labor Camps Ensure complete adherence to all guidelines relating to PPE Equipments, displaying signs and hoardings at all levels and various project locations

Qualification: 1. Graduation (B.Sc / Diploma /BE) Full time is a must + Advance Diploma in Industrial Safety from State Board Technical Education is mandatory. Experience:  5 to 10 years of Experience in Highrise residential, Indistrial projects, Commercial is must. Also should have experience working with a Contracting Company. Interested candidates may share CVs to  shital.nagrale@shapoorji.com

column2: Role & responsibilities   Identify potential hazards. Develop and implement risk management strategies. Create and update safety policies and procedures. Ensure compliance with safety regulations. Conduct safety training programs. Promote awareness of safety protocols among personnel. Perform regular safety inspections and audits. Document findings and recommend corrective actions. Develop emergency response plans and procedures. Conduct emergency drills and simulations. Investigate accidents, incidents, and near-misses. Implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence. Maintain safety equipment and ensure functionality. Monitor the usage and inventory of personal protective equipment (PPE). Ensure adherence to safety laws and regulations. Stay updated on relevant safety standards. Collaborate with engineering, operations, and maintenance teams. Provide safety input during the design and modification of systems. Encourage a proactive safety culture within the organization. Engage employees in safety practices and reporting. Maintain records of safety inspections, incident reports, and training sessions. Prepare regular safety performance reports.

column2: Greetings from Ashkom! We are hiring for the role of  Manager - Construction Safety  for the well known  MNC FMCG company , position based at   Sanand - Ahmedabad. JOB DESCRIPTION Designation  : Manager - Construction Safety Location  : Sanand - Ahmedabad. Experience  : 8 to 13 years Qualification  : Safety Diploma -NEBOSH Responsibilities Construction management for site activities & overall co-ordination with P&G teams, contractors & stakeholders. Site activities tracking and control safety Good knowledge of Industrial safety, Diploma in Construction/Industrial Safety Manage daily, weekly and monthly meetings and share required reports & presentation Hands on experience of Site safety regulation and compliances Extended knowledge of electrical and fire safety Provide regular safety outage details and mitigation plans. Understand particular Site safety norms and effective implementation Good knowledge of site construction safety Provide value addition in term of safety Coordinate with all site concern team and different stream work Verification of site safety status Provide regular updates to client. Preferred, same type of working experience and safety qualification. Interested applicants can share their resume on shweta.s.ashkom@gmail.com You can share this among the relevant candidates. References are highly appreciated.
